Detailed Description

Run-time exception handling for the math library.

The error type is internally set by the library.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Package              : The Math Library - Ex
// Authors              : Vilas Kumar Chitrakaran
// Start Date           : Wed Dec 20 11:08:28 GMT 2000
// Compiler             : GNU C++ 2.95.3 and above
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------
// File: MathException.t.cpp
// Example program for the class MathExceptions.
//========================================================================  
 
#include "Matrix.hpp"

int main()
{

 Matrix<2,2> m1, m2;

 m1 = 1.0, 5.6, 2.7, 8.4;
 
 // Enclose critical code inside try block.
 //subsequent catch block catches exceptions
 try
 {
  m2 = m1/0.0; /* divide by zero! */
 }
 catch (MathException &ex)
 {
  cout << ex.getErrorMessage() << endl;
  /* do exception recovery here */
  return -1;
 }
 cout << "This line won't print" << endl;
 return 0;
}

char* MathException::getErrorMessage (   )  [inline]
 

return The exception error message string.

bool MathException::isErrorTypeDimensionTooLarge (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
true if exception is caused by a matrix of dimensions too large for the math library to handle. (For example: calling inverse() on matrices larger than 8 x 8.)

bool MathException::isErrorTypeDivideByZero (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
true if exception is caused by a division by zero.

bool MathException::isErrorTypeIncompatibleSize (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
true if exception is caused by operation between two non-conformable matrices/vectors.

bool MathException::isErrorTypeIndexOutOfRange (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
true if exception is caused by an out of range index.

bool MathException::isErrorTypeSingularMatrix (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
true if exception is caused by a matrix of determinant zero.

bool MathException::isErrorTypeTypeMismatch (   )  [inline]
 

Returns:
true if exception is caused by operation between incompatible types.
